titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Charles Mathews performance handbills 1977.533
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

did.abstract: Two handbills from an unknown newspaper for a performance by Charles Mathews in New York City in 1834. One handbill is a notice for the public to protest the performance, while the other, issued by E. Simpson, argues against the first and urges the public to see the performance.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. Formally accessioned in 1977.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Two handbills from an unknown newspaper for a performance by Charles Mathews in New York City in 1834. One handbill is a notice for the public to protest the performance, while the other, issued by E. Simpson, argues against the first and urges the public to see the performance.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Charles Mathews (1776-1835) was a well-known British comedic actor who made two tours through the United States during his career.
